questions.question: Which ancient ruin, located in the Andes, is known for its sophisticated dry-stone construction and was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1983?
questions.context: This Incan citadel, often referred to as the 'Lost City of the Incas', provides insights into Incan civilization before the Spanish conquest.

questions.question: Which museum in Europe, established in 1793 and renowned for housing the Mona Lisa, is one of the most visited museums in the world?
questions.context: Located in a former royal palace, this museum contains more than 380,000 objects and 35,000 works of art.

questions.question: Which modern architectural marvel, completed in 2010, holds the title of being the tallest building in the world?
questions.context: Standing at 828 meters, this skyscraper exemplifies neo-futuristic design and attracts millions of visitors annually.

questions.question: In which city can you find a dark tourism site that memorializes the deadly explosion that occurred in 1986 at a nuclear power station?
questions.context: This site serves as a poignant reminder of the nuclear disaster and now attracts visitors interested in learning about the event's impact on the region.

questions.question: Known for its iconic white marble construction, which world wonder located in Agra was built in the mid-17th century as a mausoleum for a Mughal Empress?
questions.context: Commissioned by Emperor Shah Jahan, this monument is admired for its architectural beauty and is a symbol of love.
